definition[0]: an impossible situation that you cannot solve because you need to do one thing in order to do a second thing, but you cannot do the first thing until you have done the second
example[0]: It’s a Catch-22 situation – without experience you can’t get a job and without a job you can’t get experience.
definition[1]: a situation in which it seems impossible to make progress because you cannot do one thing until you have done another thing, but the second thing cannot happen until the first thing has happened
example[1]: It’s a catch-22 situation; without experience you can’t get a job and without a job you can’t get experience.
